title.narrative: Maji Ya Amani: Operationalizing the Theory of Change (TOC) for the Great Lakes Region Integrated Water and Food Security Program

description.narrative: Please note that baseline for indicators measuring changes linked or related to community structures will be established when these structures are fully in place (but not yet utilized) to ensure relevance of findings. In addition, indicators explicitly relating to a perception of change occurring after the project, such as “% of population who consider women have more influence in the management of water since the beginning of the project” do not require a baseline. Finally output indicators such as “#of schools/health facilities improved or built” also do not require a baseline – as these are direct physical constructions of the project.

The program adopts an integrated approach to reducing conflict between competing ethnic groups and increasing stability in the Ruzizi Plain through increased and more equitable access to land and water for household and agricultural use, and improved governance around the management of these resources.

mailing-address.narrative: International Rescue Committee 122 East 42nd Street New York, New York 10168-1289 USA

sector.narrative: IRC TU: Protection and Rule of Law
IRC TU: Women's Protection and Empowerment

comment.narrative: Level of knowledge and number of people demonstrating strong knowledge of the subject matter is often higher just after sensitizations and training than it is after a certain period of time has passed. comment.narrative: This value is calculated considering a sample taken of all the total beneficiaries, based on their own perceptions / reported satisfaction. Respondents may estimate that they do not have sufficient/ the same access as before because actual outputs may differ from expectations held by these respondents. For example, in the case of access to drinking water, some people surveyed who were expecting to have access at all times or to have a tap in their own homes have reported that they do not have access to drinking water, though taps are available within the community.

title.narrative: Number of people who accept and apply Family Planning methods due to the project.

comment.narrative: 231 at Luberizi Health Centre, 101 at Mutarule Health Centre and 402 at the Sange general reference hospital.

title.narrative: % of supported health facilities providing family planning (FP) services, which are youth-friendly and meet MoH and WHO standards

comment.narrative: 3 of the 4 centres targeted have been assessed as youth-friendly and meet MoH and WHO standards, while the fourth centre requires further improvement and follow-up.

title.narrative: 4.1: Three reproductive health facilities in the intervention area are duly equipped and have at their disposal materials and supplies to provide quality reproductive health services
% of reproductive health facilities adequately equipped, compared to the number of facilities targeted (3.1.2_ii of I4S)

comment.narrative: 3 out of 4 targeted health centres are adequately equipped

title.narrative: % of reproductive health facilities with adequate spaces, compared to the number of facilities targeted (3.1.2_i of I4S)

comment.narrative: 3 out of 4 targeted health centres have adequate spaces, while the fourth requires further improvement.

title.narrative: 4.2: Reproductive Health providers in the supported reproductive health facilities have increased clinical skills to provide quality reproductive health services
% of reproductive health providers offering clinical care for sexual assault survivors, consistently meeting 80% of the quality criteria (5.3.3_i of I4S)

comment.narrative: 3 of the 4 centres targeted offered clinical care for sexual assault survivors and consistently met 80% of the quality criteria

title.narrative: % of trained reproductive health providers that receive monthly individualized FP, PAC and GBV coaching visits

comment.narrative: 45 reproductive health providers have been trained as of 31 December 2018, among them 9 in Family Planning, 7 in post-abortion care, and 29 in GBV response.

title.narrative: 3.8: Local Youth access employment opportunities in latrine construction
Number of local young people (boys and girls from the different ethnic groups )who learned how to build latrines and retained business skills after training

comment.narrative: As of 31 December 2018, 50 young people have been trained on how to build latrines (17F, 33 M). Assessment of the level of retention on business skills after training is set to take place in 2019.

title.narrative: Number of self-financed latrines by households due to the promotion and marketing of young entrepreneurs trained

comment.narrative: This indicator is set to be measured in 2019 after implementation of the related activities has been carried out.

title.narrative: 2.8 The DWUA and its sub-committees, together with community members, participate in the design, supervision and monitoring of the construction of Luberizi water supply system
# of water points in the water system functioning with involvement of community members and sub-committees of the DWUA

comment.narrative: As of 31 December 2018, 72 water points have been established, with 156 taps. The will be functioning with the involvement of community members and sub-committees of the DWUA/ACEP.

title.narrative: Reduction in conflict and increase in stability in the Ruzizi plain
% of women and men reporting having been a victim of violence or crime in the last 6 months (5_ii of I4S)

comment.narrative: At the time of initial publishing (September 2018) 24.7% of women and men surveyed reported knowing at least one victim of violence or crime in the last 6 months.

As of April 2019, 69.3% of those surveyed reported knowing at least one victim of violence or crime in the last six months. Increasing values do not necessarily indicate an increase in the phenomenon, however, as this can also indicate increased knowledge about the phenomenon and increased willingness to report. Further assessment of this indicator is planned for the remaining years of the project lifespan.

title.narrative: % of men and women rating the local government performance as "very good" or "good" considering job creation and increase in employment, unification of different ethnic groups, ensuring security (3_i of I4S)
